posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

This is the last of my Henchmen Rebuilds. I have heard only recently that you can also play Mischa Waymeet with a certain Vault file, but I have never played with her myself, nor will I go back to playing SoU just to play her. So if anyone wants to post her remake, please do so. As for me, I finish with the cutest little destruction machine called Deekin. Since there is no Kobold race in NWN, I made him a Gnome, but you can use the sub-race to kind of correct that (although he will still receive penalty to STR and increase to CON). He begins his life as a little Bard thingy who is afraid to engage in melee combat, so he will start by learning to use his cute little crossbow and stay out of harm's way. Then as he discovers he has Dragon Blood in his veins, he becomes increasingly more powerful and confident, switching to a melee weapon, a shortsword, and dealing heavy punishment to his foes. He should have more Bard upfront, but this is a Powerbuild for him, so I try to imagine that the build should suit his story before and after he happened to participate in the campaigns, so that it can be more about his personality than anything else. From then on it's a very straightforward and solid Bard / RDD build who gets Lasting Inspiration to symbolize his striving for Kobolds to become less evil and more social creatures.

Anyway, Deekin Scalesinger!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A power-built Deekin!

Suggestions:
Drop the x-bow feats to free up 3 pre epic feats for expertise, still spell and improved critical. Take the shortsword feats earlier.
Take EWF shortsword at lvl 21 and armor skin at lvl 27 and shuffle the levelling order in epic to take fighter 9 at lvl 24 for EWS shortsword.

If you like roleplaying and want to fool around with a x-bow, you're free to do so, but don't waste feats on it.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:A power-built Deekin!

Suggestions:
Drop the x-bow feats to free up 3 pre epic feats for expertise, still spell and improved critical. Take the shortsword feats earlier.
Take EWF shortsword at lvl 21 and armor skin at lvl 27 and shuffle the levelling order in epic to take fighter 9 at lvl 24 for EWS shortsword.

If you like roleplaying and want to fool around with a x-bow, you're free to do so, but don't waste feats on it.
I am aware I could have powerbuilt him more, but those feats were taken for RP. I imagined him this way: at first he was a little scared Kobold with low self-confidence so he wouldn't engage in melee for that reason. However, as the dragon blood in him grew stronger, he became more confident and even more likely to engage in a melee confrontation, then he starts investing in Taunts and Bard Song to support his already strong Melee presence. I always take AS before EWF because on WoG, AC is more important than AB, but you can swap them if it suits you better.

Thanks for the feedback, if it wasn't for the fact I am trying to make theme builds, I definitely wouldn't have bothered with the X-bow feats, especially with such a low DEX. Again, powerbuilding-wise these are a waste, so you can get rid of: WF and WS Light X-bow, Rapid Reload and Point Blank Shot, and Called Shot as well, so there is plenty of room for improvement here

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Deekin a bit of late - as the best henchie in any of the official campaigns. Then I remembered that Max had built him already - hooray! And I like the Gnome for quirkiness - I'd been thinking Hin. Either gets an xp penalty, but worth it imo. You could get round it by going CoT instead of Fighter, but the RP balance might get out of whack. Plus you'd lose E/WS and another BF.

Theoretically, if you drop the X-bow and related feats, there's room for Imp Crit and Great Cleave, as well as maybe Still Spell, KD and IKD. And you could actually end up with a Dev Critting Deekin! You'd have to sacrifice 2 Great Strengths for Ow and Dev Crit, but it's tempting ain't it?

Sorry to bump from way back, but this could really be fun (be nice if we could get his voice, though)!

Cheers

posts.content: About 12 years ago, the drive that I had NWN installed on crashed, and I couldn't play NWN for about a year.  I was in Chapter 2 in my very first play-though of the OC.  During that time, I had a lot of fun making builds.  With all I have learned since then, I would now consider those builds to be not very good, but I sure was having fun.
